intro: Fagraea longicuspis, commonly known as the long-spined fagraea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens, making it visually striking. Fagraea longicuspis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
